item.title: OpenAI signs deal to train on Condé Nast content, surface stories in ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
OpenAI has inked a deal with Condé Nast, the publisher of storied outlets such as The New Yorker, Vogue, Vanity Fair, Bon Appétit and Wired, to surface stories from Condé Nast properties in OpenAI’s AI-powered chatbot platform ChatGPT and its search prototype SearchGPT. The specific terms of the partnership weren’t disclosed. But in a memo […]

item.title: PayPal could challenge Apple Wallet in the EU
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Though PayPal has not yet confirmed it will now develop a competing wallet thanks to new APIs, the company has hinted in that such a plan is in the works.

item.title: Fintech shutdowns, Klarna’s move into banking and which companies are hiring
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
Welcome to TechCrunch Fintech! This week, we’re looking at the respective demise of Tally and Score, plus examining Klarna’s latest business move. We also have a list of fintech companies that are looking to add headcount. To get a roundup of TechCrunch’s biggest and most important fintech stories delivered to your inbox every Tuesday at […]

item.title: How Fabric plans to make advanced cryptography ubiquitous
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Fabric has developed a custom RISC-V-based chip that is optimized to run the algorithms necessary to establish zero-knowledge proofs and enable fully homomorphic encryption.

item.title: Life sciences investor BEVC raising $25M climate fund
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
BEVC is the latest life sciences VC to add planetary health to its portfolio, suggesting that the trend is catching hold.

item.title: YouTube takes on TikTok Shop with expanded Shopify partnership
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
As TikTok Shop gains traction, YouTube is expanding its partnership with Shopify to onboard more brands for its YouTube Shopping affiliate program, the company announced on Tuesday. The expanded partnership means creators will get access to thousands of new brands to tag in their shopping videos, marking a significant increase from the few hundred brands […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Ikea is expanding its fleet of inventory drones
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
If you went 20 years into the past and asked someone what we’d be using drones for now, they’d probably guess that we’d be getting our packages airlifted from across the country directly to our doorstep… but as it turns out, that isn’t very realistic (and honestly, ground shipping is fine). That doesn’t mean drones […]

item.title: Waymo is now giving 100,000 robotaxi rides a week
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Waymo disclosed Tuesday it’s now giving more than 100,000 paid robotaxi rides every week across its three main commercial markets in Los Angeles, San Francisco and Phoenix. Those figures were shared by Waymo co-CEO Tekedra Mawakana in a social media post on X. The new 100,000 figure is double what the company has previously disclosed. […]

item.title: Discover how founders and investors are saving the planet at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
Until recently, saving the world usually didn’t involve turning a profit. But as the world has warmed, a range of startups and investors have emerged that have squared the circle, making a clear business case for reducing humanity’s impact on the planet. item.title: US government accuses Iran of Trump campaign hack; Iran scoffs
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
On Monday, the U.S. government formally accused Iran of hacking the Donald Trump campaign. In a joint statement issued by the FBI, the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI) and the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), the three agencies said that the intelligence community attributes the recently disclosed hack and leak against […]

item.title: Thirty-nine state AGs now support Live Nation-Ticketmaster lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
The United States Department of Justice filed a major lawsuit against Live Nation-Ticketmaster in May, arguing that the entertainment giant is acting as a monopoly. An additional 10 state attorneys general joined the suit this week, bringing the total to 39 states and the District of Columbia. The plaintiffs also filed an amended complaint, making […]

item.title: Sarah Buchner started as a carpenter when she was 12 — now her AI construction startup has raised $20 million
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Construction companies deal with a lot of documents — so many that it can be difficult to process and manage them all. According to one recent survey, a third of construction professionals found accessing documents to be a challenge in completing a project, while a fourth said that inaccurate project paperwork has contributed to a […]

item.title: The Rounds scoops up $24M to bring its ‘household restocking’ delivery service to more markets
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
The Rounds, the startup that delivers recurring grocery and household essentials in reusable packaging, announced on Monday its $24 million Series B funding round. The new capital will go toward product development, hiring and expanding the service to additional markets. Alongside the funding announcement, The Rounds introduced new features for customers, including the ability to […]

item.title: Defcon AI closes $44M seed round to solve a problem of ‘maximum complexity’: Military logistics
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
The U.S. Department of Defense is a mammoth organization. It not only employs millions of service members and hundreds of thousands of civilian employees, but also has the world’s largest military budget that’s used to buy and maintain more equipment than can likely fit into a single paragraph.  It’s a lot to coordinate. Operators within […]

item.title: BeyondMath’s ‘digital wind tunnel’ puts a physics-based AI simulation to work on F1 cars
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Simulating the real world is a tremendously complex problem if you want to do it at any useful level of fidelity. Traditional techniques are holding back design teams at vehicle and aerospace companies, but BeyondMath is putting AI on the task with a new way of simulating the world that could save them days or […]

item.title: Starpath accelerates moon water mining plans with $12M in funding
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
NASA and the space industry are in agreement: If we want to establish a permanent human presence on the moon, we’ll need to make use of every native resource we can — and none are as important as water ice.  Starpath Robotics is one of a handful of startups planning for this future. item.title: Reliant’s paper-scouring AI takes on science’s data drudgery
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
AI models have proven capable of many things, but what tasks do we actually want them doing? Preferably drudgery — and there’s plenty of that in research and academia. Reliant hopes to specialize in the kind of time-consuming data extraction work that’s currently a specialty of tired grad students and interns. “The best thing you […]

item.title: Mike Lynch, recently acquitted in HP-Autonomy fraud case, is missing after yacht capsized off Sicily (updated)
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Update: Authorities have yet to access the inside of the sunken yacht, and Mike Lynch is still classified as missing. Other details have emerged in the interim. The accident appears to have been caused by a major storm and a resulting tornado-like water column that ensnared and damaged the yacht. Among the other six people […]
